Package us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.interfaces

Interface Orientation2DReadOnly

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    FixedFrameOrientation2DBasics, FrameOrientation2DBasics, FrameOrientation2DReadOnly, Orientation2DBasics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FrameOrientation2D, Orientation2D
    public interface Orientation2DReadOnly
    Read-only interface for a 2D orientation.

    A 2D orientation is in the XY-plane, i.e. the yaw angle about the z-axis.

    Author:
    Sylvain Bertrand

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default boolean containsNaN()
      Tests if this orientation 2D contains Double.NaN.
      default double difference​(Orientation2DReadOnly other)
      Computes and returns the difference between this and other:
      distance = this.yaw - other.yaw
      default double distance​(Orientation2DReadOnly other)
      Computes the distance between this and other as the absolute difference in angle:
      distance = Math.abs(this.yaw - other.yaw)
      default boolean epsilonEquals​(Orientation2DReadOnly other, double epsilon)
      Tests if the yaw angle of this orientation is equal to an epsilon to the yaw of other.
      default boolean equals​(Orientation2DReadOnly other)
      Tests if this orientation 2D is exactly equal to other.

      Compares this to other to determine if the two orientations are geometrically similar, i.e.

    • Method Detail

      • getYaw

        double getYaw()
        Returns the current yaw angle of this orientation 2D.
        Returns:
        the angle value in radians.

      • containsNaN

        default boolean containsNaN()
        Tests if this orientation 2D contains Double.NaN.
        Returns:
        true if this orientation 2D contains a Double.NaN, false otherwise.

      • difference

        default double difference​(Orientation2DReadOnly other)
        Computes and returns the difference between this and other:
        distance = this.yaw - other.yaw
        Parameters:
        other - the other orientation 2D. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the difference between this and other contained in [-pi, pi].

      • distance

        default double distance​(Orientation2DReadOnly other)
        Computes the distance between this and other as the absolute difference in angle:
        distance = Math.abs(this.yaw - other.yaw)
        Parameters:
        other - the other orientation 2D. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the distance between this and other contained in [0, pi].

      • transform

        default void transform​(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Tuple2DBasics tupleToTransform)
        Transforms the given tupleToTransform by the rotation about the z-axis described by this. 
         tupleToTransform = / cos(yaw) -sin(yaw) \ * tupleToTransform
                    \ sin(yaw)  cos(yaw) /
        Parameters:
        tupleToTransform - the tuple to transform. Modified.

      • transform

        default void transform​(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Tuple2DReadOnly tupleOriginal,
                       us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Tuple2DBasics tupleTransformed)
        Transforms the given tupleOriginal by the rotation about the z-axis described by this and stores the result in tupleTransformed. 
         tupleTransformed = / cos(yaw) -sin(yaw) \ * tupleOriginal
                    \ sin(yaw)  cos(yaw) /
        Parameters:
        tupleOriginal - the tuple to be transformed. Not modified.
        tupleTransformed - the tuple in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • transform

        default void transform​(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Tuple3DBasics tupleToTransform)
        Transforms the given tupleToTransform by the rotation about the z-axis described by this. 
                            / cos(yaw) -sin(yaw) 0 \
 tupleToTransform = | sin(yaw)  cos(yaw) 0 | * tupleToTransform
                    \    0         0     1 /
        Parameters:
        tupleToTransform - the tuple to transform. Modified.

      • transform

        default void transform​(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Tuple3DReadOnly tupleOriginal,
                       us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Tuple3DBasics tupleTransformed)
        Transforms the given tupleOriginal by the rotation about the z-axis described by this and stores the result in tupleTransformed. 
                            / cos(yaw) -sin(yaw) 0 \
 tupleTransformed = | sin(yaw)  cos(yaw) 0 | * tupleOriginal
                    \    0         0     1 /
        Parameters:
        tupleOriginal - the tuple to be transformed. Not modified.
        tupleTransformed - the tuple in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • inverseTransform

        default void inverseTransform​(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Tuple2DBasics tupleToTransform)
        Performs the inverse of the transform to the given tupleToTransform by the rotation about the z-axis described by this. 
         tupleToTransform = / cos(-yaw) -sin(-yaw) \ * tupleToTransform
                    \ sin(-yaw)  cos(-yaw) /
        Parameters:
        tupleToTransform - the tuple to transform. Modified.

      • inverseTransform

        default void inverseTransform​(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Tuple2DReadOnly tupleOriginal,
                              us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Tuple2DBasics tupleTransformed)
        Performs the inverse of the transform to the given tupleOriginal by the rotation about the z-axis described by this and stores the result in tupleTransformed. 
         tupleTransformed = / cos(-yaw) -sin(-yaw) \ * tupleOriginal
                    \ sin(-yaw)  cos(-yaw) /
        Parameters:
        tupleOriginal - the tuple to be transformed. Not modified.
        tupleTransformed - the tuple in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • inverseTransform

        default void inverseTransform​(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Tuple3DBasics tupleToTransform)
        Performs the inverse of the transform to the given tupleToTransform by the rotation about the z-axis described by this. 
                            / cos(-yaw) -sin(-yaw) 0 \
 tupleToTransform = | sin(-yaw)  cos(-yaw) 0 | * tupleToTransform
                    \     0          0     1 /
        Parameters:
        tupleToTransform - the tuple to transform. Modified.

      • inverseTransform

        default void inverseTransform​(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Tuple3DReadOnly tupleOriginal,
                              us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Tuple3DBasics tupleTransformed)
        Performs the inverse of the transform to the given tupleOriginal by the rotation about the z-axis described by this and stores the result in tupleTransformed. 
                            / cos(-yaw) -sin(-yaw) 0 \
 tupleTransformed = | sin(-yaw)  cos(-yaw) 0 | * tupleOriginal
                    \     0          0     1 /
        Parameters:
        tupleOriginal - the tuple to be transformed. Not modified.
        tupleTransformed - the tuple in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • epsilonEquals

        default boolean epsilonEquals​(Orientation2DReadOnly other,
                              double epsilon)
        Tests if the yaw angle of this orientation is equal to an epsilon to the yaw of other.

        Note that this method performs number comparison and not an angle comparison, such that: -pi ≠ pi.

        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two orientations are equal, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        default boolean geometricallyEquals​(Orientation2DReadOnly other,
                                    double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two orientations are geometrically similar, i.e. the difference in yaw of this and other is less than or equal to epsilon.
        Parameters:
        other - the orientation to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two orientations represent the same geometry, false otherwise.

      • equals

        default boolean equals​(Orientation2DReadOnly other)
        Tests if this orientation 2D is exactly equal to other.

        Note that this method performs number comparison and not an angle comparison, such that: -pi ≠ pi.

        Parameters:
        other - the other orientation 2D to compare against this. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two orientations are exactly equal, false otherwise.
